name: LMW-tree
tagline: Learning M-Way Tree - EM-tree, K-tree, k-means, TSVQ, repeated k-means, clustering, random projections, random indexing, hashing, bit signatures
body:
### Learning M-Way Tree
LMW-tree is a generic template library written in C++ that implements several
algorithms that use the m-way nearest neighbor tree structure to store their
data. The algorithms and data structures are generic to support different
data representations and functionality.

The algorithms are primarily focussed on computationally efficient clustering.
[Clustering](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cluster_analysis) is an
[unsupervised machine learning](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Unsupervised_learning)
process that finds interesting patterns in data. It can be used for nearest
neighbor search, supervised learning and other machine learning applications.

The [Parallel Streaming Signature EM-tree](http://eprints.qut.edu.au/84386/)
has produced document clusters for the [ClueWeb](http://www.lemurproject.org/clueweb12.php/)
large scale web crawls. This result was presented at the [2015 International World Wide Web conference](http://www.www2015.it/accepted-papers/). Document clustering at this scale has not previously
been reported.

See the [ClueWeb09 clusters](http://ktree.sourceforge.net/emtree/clueweb09/)
and the [ClueWeb12 clusters](http://ktree.sourceforge.net/emtree/clueweb12/)
for examples of [document clusters](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Document_clustering)
produced by the Parallel Streaming Signature EM-tree algorithm. The ClueWeb09
dataset contains 500 million web pages and was clustered into 700,000 clusters.
The ClueWeb12 datasets contains 733 million web pages and was clustered into
600,000 clusters. The document to cluster mappings and other related files area
available at [SourceForge](http://sourceforge.net/projects/ktree/files/clueweb_clusters/).

LMW-tree is licensed under the BSD license.

### Authors and Contributors
Lance De Vine (@ldevine)
Chris de Vries (@cmdevries)
This project has been supported by the Queensland University Technology via the Big Data Lab and the Deputy Vice Chancellor's PhD scholarship.

### Support or Contact
